results.title: Harambee, the world of the award
results.creator_credit: Stephen Cross, Robert Angell and Lion Pacesetter Films
results.brief_description: The Duke of Edinburgh’s Award Scheme is Commonwealth wide and it operates in forty countries. This film epitomises the spirit of the Award Scheme as shown in Kenya in 1971 when Gold Award winners from sixteen different countries gathered to learn, work and explore together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Cross, Robert Angell and Lion Pacesetter Films

results.title: Happy youth in sun and snow: winter holidays in Switzerland
results.brief_description: This film describes the facilities for children to learn winter sports under expert guidance. Skating, ice hockey, toboganning are shown, and training in skiing from the nursery slopes to racing is seen in some detail. No commentary, music soundtrack only.

results.title: The Happy toilers
results.creator_credit: Keith David Smith and Children's Library and Craft Movement
results.brief_description: An amateur record of the efforts by children attending a crafts centre in a migrant hostel to build their own swimming pool. Made at Bradfield Park Housing Settlement and the Lane Cove National Park.

results.title: Happy riding. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Mark Lawton, Euryn Ogwen-Williams, BBC Cymru Wales and Vis News
results.brief_description: Part two in the series on the art of horse riding. The topic of this film is looking after your pony. Tips on successful grooming and care are given by expert John Bateman and includes use of dandy brush, body brush, curvy comb, wisp, sponge. Use of blankets, plaiting and shoeing are also covered.

results.title: Happy riding. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Mark Lawton, Euryn Ogwen-Williams, BBC Cymru Wales and Vis News
results.brief_description: One of a series which examines the art of horse riding. This film deals with buying a pony and other aspects such as what to look for when buying a pony, horse sales, postures, fencing and shelters, feeding, equipment, stable management and veterinary reports

results.title: The Happy Revolution (New Methods in Primary Eduction)
results.creator_credit: Robert Tyrrell and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A new approach to British primary education which is being debated and developed. Pupils’ minds are being opened to new worlds of ideas and experience. Children are being encouraged to find out things for themselves; through observation and exchange of ideas, but literacy is still the key to everything.

results.title: The Happy pace of Switzerland
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Gessner, Condor Films and Swiss National Tourist Office
results.brief_description: A story without words set to Rossini’s “String Sonata in C Major” performed by the Zurich Chamber Orchestra led by Edmond de Stoutz, involves a modern day fantasy about a truck driver’s encounter with an elegant, riderless, horse drawn coach. The parallel paths of truck and coach on the opposite shores of a lovely Swiss lake merge in a climax when the driver abandons his truck and joyfully takes up the reins behind the trotting white horse.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicolas Gessner, Condor Films and Swiss National Tourist Office

results.title: Happily ever after
results.creator_credit: John Honey and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatization of wife bashing. A young couple are about to be married. The young man spends the night at a buck’s party and the girl plays party games. The parents have a celebration dinner which ends in a wife-bashing session.
results.description: A dramatization of wife bashing. A young couple are about to be married. The young man spends the night at a buck’s party and the girl plays party games. The parents have a celebration dinner which ends in a wife-bashing session.

results.title: Happiness Is Loving Your Teacher
results.creator_credit: John Smith, Vladimir Valenta and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A crippled substitute teacher has great difficulty controlling a class of students, especially a girl called Toni. Kept in detention, Toni walks out after verbally attacking the teacher. Next day, as the normal teacher has returned, the substitute teacher does not have to face the class. A repentant Toni rings him up and makes them both feel better. Stars Marina Dimakopoulos, Martin Kevin. Written by Mariette Cook, John N. Smith.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Smith, Vladimir Valenta and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses happiness
results.brief_description: Lord Russell describes the factors which he considers necessary for happiness: health, sufficient means to keep one from want, happy personal relations and successful work. He also discusses what he considers to be the sources of unhappiness: worry, envy and boredom. No other credits available.
